executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. The Online Survey Software industry develops software for market research, product testing, and other customizable uses like employee satisfaction or consumer preferences. Industry operators offer clients a product that is less costly to run but also more time efficient, interactive, and can be easily integrated with data analytics platforms. As a result, many companies have reduced their use of traditional market research activities, which rely on physical results collection and often generate lower response rates and operational efficiency. Instead, users increasingly opt to extract feedback using services provided by online survey software companies at a fraction of the cost.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rapid Technological Advancements Benefit the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The online survey software industry has experienced technological advancements that have improved user interfaces, enhanced data analysis capabilities, and more sophisticated survey creation tools. These advancements have attracted both new users and existing users looking to upgrade their survey capabilities. Artificial intelligence (AI) and automation are integrated into survey software to enhance data analysis, insights generation, and even survey creation.

Businesses across various sectors have been increasingly emphasizing data-driven decision-making. This trend has led to a higher demand for online survey software as organizations seek to gather insights directly from their target audiences to inform their strategies. With the growing use of mobile devices, survey software providers have prioritized creating mobile-responsive surveys to ensure a seamless experience for respondents across different devices.

COVID-19 accelerated the adoption of remote work and digital transformation. Online survey software became essential for businesses and organizations looking to continue collecting feedback and insights from their audiences despite physical limitations. Online survey software providers have recognized the importance of integration with other business tools like CRM systems, marketing platforms, and analytics tools. This integration streamlines data flow and analysis.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AI-Enhanced Survey Insights and Advanced Personalization
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning could play a more prominent role in survey analysis, offering automated insights, sentiment analysis, and predictive analytics based on survey responses. Online surveys will likely become more personalized, tailoring questions and experiences based on respondent characteristics and behavior to enhance engagement and data accuracy. Surveys may incorporate more voice and video response options, allowing participants to provide more natural and expressive feedback.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Demand for Real-Time Data and Mobile Surveys Will Increase
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Businesses increasingly demand real-time data, which drives demand for survey software to collect and analyze data quickly and easily. Many survey software providers will likely offer mobile-friendly surveys, which can be accessed and completed on smartphones and tablets. This makes it easier for businesses to reach a wider audience with their surveys.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Social Media Provides Both an Opportunity and a Threat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Social media platforms are becoming increasingly popular for collecting data. Businesses can use social media platforms to collect data about their customers' interests, behaviors, and demographics. This data can be used to create more effective surveys, or it can be used to bypass the need for surveys altogether.

industry_definition: This industry develops online survey software for use in market research, product testing and gathering information on customer and employee satisfaction. Online surveys ask respondents a list of specific questions to gauge their opinions. Results are then collated and supplied to the author of the questions.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Technology and software developers aim to quantify their audience size and understand the preferences of their viewers.
Other markets include financial services, transportation, manufacturing, education, and research.

Manufacturers of nondurable products produce food, beverages, confectionary items, over-the-counter medicines, tobacco and cigarettes, cosmetics, and hygiene products. Manufacturers use online survey software to gather insights, improve processes, and enhance customer experiences.

The pharmaceutical sector is highly competitive, particularly among generic and brand-name manufacturers, placing more importance on the marketing and branding of the company itself. Pharmaceutical companies use surveys to collect participant data in clinical trials and research studies. Surveys help gather patient feedback, monitor side effects, assess treatment effectiveness, and gather critical clinical data. Online surveys enable pharmaceutical companies to collect patient-reported outcomes, which provide insights into the patient experience with medications and treatments.

Ad agencies use surveys to gather consumer insights, preferences, behaviors, and opinions. This information helps shape marketing strategies, campaign messaging, and product positioning. Before launching a new advertising campaign, agencies can use surveys to test campaign concepts, messaging, visuals, and slogans.

Government agencies use online surveys to engage the public on proposed regulations, policy changes, infrastructure projects, and public services. Surveys provide a platform for citizens to voice their opinions and contribute to decision-making processes.

products_and_services.product_description: The Online Survey Software industry provides customers with the tools to design and publish online surveys. This software, accountable for most industry revenue, includes internet-based tools to conduct various types of surveys, from open-ended to multiple-choice. Software often provides clients with templates to fill in, although some companies enable users to upload Word documents that are then transposed into an internet-based survey. Survey companies also offer advanced technologies, such as skip-logic, question randomization, video and other features, for an additional fee.

Companies provide analytical tools for clients to assess the survey results. These tools are also often internet-based, though a portion of results can also be downloaded in Excel, text, or CSV formats. A few companies offer advanced features like full cross-tabs, text analysis, and SPSS (statistical analysis software) integration. As traditional market research firms increasingly offer online alternatives, these advanced tools are growing as a share of the products offered by this industry.

The industry also offers customer support for users with questions or issues with online survey software; they can often talk to or e-mail company representatives to resolve the issues. Escalating internal and external competition is pushing companies to offer additional services.

tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US
Data Processing & Hosting Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Widespread Use of Technology Increases Revenue
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Technology and software developers aim to quantify their audience size and understand the preferences of their viewers. Consumer consumption of technology products has increased drastically as more people purchase smartphones and other devices. This results in technology and software companies investing more in developing new products.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Development of the Vaccine Lowered Pharmaceutical Market Research
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The pharmaceutical sector is highly competitive, particularly among generic and brand-name manufacturers, placing more importance on the marketing and branding of the company itself. Pharmaceutical companies use surveys to collect participant data in clinical trials and research studies. Surveys help gather patient feedback, monitor side effects, assess treatment effectiveness, and gather critical clinical data. Online surveys enable pharmaceutical companies to collect patient-reported outcomes, which provide insights into the patient experience with medications and treatments.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Online Surveys Help Government Agencies Engage with the Public
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Government agencies use online surveys to engage the public on proposed regulations, policy changes, infrastructure projects, and public services. Surveys provide a platform for citizens to voice their opinions and contribute to decision-making processes.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Advertising Agencies Rely on Market Research for Campaign Metrics
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Ad agencies use surveys to gather consumer insights, preferences, behaviors, and opinions. This information helps shape marketing strategies, campaign messaging, and product positioning. Before launching a new advertising campaign, agencies can use surveys to test campaign concepts, messaging, visuals, and slogans.
Other markets include financial services, transportation, manufacturing, education, and research.

business_locations.location_description: The West has been a hotbed of software innovation for years, hosting Silicon Valley, Hollywood, and Los Angeles only a few hours' drive from each other. California contains over a fifth of all establishments in the nation, almost twice as concentrated as any other state.

While the Southeast does not carry the name recognition of Western region destinations, it benefits from a massive labor pool, key for an industry defined by its workforce. Florida is also fast becoming a region of start-up activity, generating new software development establishments at an unprecedented rate. The Southeast region is anticipated to grow as the high cost of living in the West becomes untenable.

The Mid-Atlantic region contains the United States' financial heart, making it a strategic area for significant players and software companies selling to large businesses. New York also acts as a labor hub for the entire region, drawing in younger talent, which costs less to hire. Still, the region suffers from the same cost-of-living challenges as the West, with high rents driving skilled programmers away.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The United States does not have federal regulations regarding data usage, causing it to fall under state jurisdiction. California, Colorado, and Virginia have set the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (CCPA), the Colorado Privacy Act (CPA aka ColoPA), and the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA). These acts limit the usage of consumer data for business purposes.
Data and data analysis are considered intellectual property. The usage of information produced by market research companies is allowed with the proper attribution.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The initial development of the survey software requires a significant amount of skilled labor, including software developers, designers, and user experience experts.
Ongoing maintenance, updates, bug fixes, and feature enhancements require continuous labor input.

factors_decreased_barrier: The availability of cloud computing and SaaS platforms makes it relatively easy for new entrants to develop and deploy online survey software.
This leads to a proliferation of small and niche players offering specialized solutions.

basis_points.basis_description: The online survey software market is becoming more fragmented, with a growing number of smaller players entering the market due to increasing demand for online surveys and availability of affordable software solutions.
The online survey software market is becoming more specialized, with providers offering solutions for specific industries or purposes due to growing demand for tailored solutions.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Though the industry is relatively new with few barriers to entry, Momentive Global Inc. (formerly Momentive Inc.) and Qualtrics, the two largest industry companies, have proliferated over the past five years and have also engaged in significant acquisition activity.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Major companies benefit from capital access and brand recognition
concentration_points.concentration_description: The two major companies also benefit from extensive access to capital and brand recognition.

While the number of enterprises is continuously rising, market share concentration is expected to remain at or near current levels as Momentive Global Inc. and Qualtrics expand and acquire their competitors.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The key to understanding the cost structure of the software industry is to realize that it does not create any tangible goods and therefore incurs few purchase costs like those traditionally required to distribute media like CDs. The primary purchases that this industry makes include servers and development platforms.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Development and Maintenance Costs Impact Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry's largest operators generate above-average profit as a share of revenue because the per-unit cost of developing industry software declines significantly with a more extensive base of users. This disparity is because of the industry's fragmented nature, comprising various small and large companies, including numerous new entrants.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: INTENSE COMPETITION FOR HIGHLY SKILLED EMPLOYEES BOOSTS WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online survey software frequently requires updates and adjustments based on more advanced demands from clients, including built-in data analytics programs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The initial development of the survey software requires a significant amount of skilled labor, including software developers, designers, and user experience experts. Ongoing maintenance, updates, bug fixes, and feature enhancements require continuous labor input.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served among incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Businesses' Health Directly Affects Demand for Market Research
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for market research is affected by the overall business cycle. When companies are experiencing favorable conditions, spending on product development and marketing increases. Lower revenue gives companies less room to spend researching and developing new products, lowering the need for online surveys.

Spending on research and development directly affects the need for market research services. Falling research and development levels represent higher business uncertainty, resulting in companies developing fewer products.

FAQs.question: How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The shift online has led to the creation of this relatively new industry. Prior to the widespread use of the internet, market research polls and surveys were conducted in person, through the mail or telephone. The internet has enabled companies to do this over the internet.

FAQs.question: How reliant is your company on advertising revenue?
FAQs.answer: The two largest companies, SurveyMonkey Inc. and Qualtrics, generate the majority of revenue through purchases made by customers. However, some companies do generate revenue through the sale of advertisements, but this is the minority of industry revenue.

FAQs.question: What is CASRO?
FAQs.answer: CASRO is an association that promotes survey research. CASRO supports lobbying initiatives and provides standards to members representing more than 300 companies globally. CASRO has also established international survey research standards that the International Standardization Organization approves.

FAQs.question: Is your company strategically located in a region that acts to your benefit?
FAQs.answer: To attract the best talent, companies should be aware of the Silicon Valley area of California, Seattle, New York City and Boston as major tech hubs. SurveyMonkey Inc. is based in California, though Qualtrics is based out of Utah.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry as a whole has been exposed to rising wages over the five years to 2019 as demand for employees is extremely competitive. However, revenue has increased at a fast rate, which has enabled profit to increase since 2013.

FAQs.question: Has your company prepared adequately to address the increased security risks posed by digital data storage?
FAQs.answer: The cyberattacks on Equifax and web hosting companies, which have temporarily shut down Twitter and Spotify, are among a number of high-profile cyberattacks in recent years. Industry developers may host extremely important corporate data which must be safeguarded against potential breaches.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to keep current with changing digital interfaces?
FAQs.answer: It is vital for software developers, especially smaller companies, to be aware of changing consumer preferences. The shift to mobile is extremely important in this industry, as some people may be more likely to complete surveys while on the go.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: On a state and local level, there are a number of groups that are looking to promote software and technology jobs in their area, but there are no significant groups that specifically target industry companies.

FAQs.question: Have any recent regulatory changes significantly affected your operations?
FAQs.answer: Regulation plays a small role in the industry. However, major companies Qualtrics and SurveyMonkey Inc. command a sizeable portion of the industry and must be aware of antitrust laws.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects that require capital financing on the horizon?
FAQs.answer: Generally speaking, barriers to entry are low in this industry. Though new entrants will be challenged to find and fund the right employees and compete against two companies who have together raised billions of dollars.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins are lower than the average software company, primarily a result of the sheer volume of startups and young companies. SurveyMonkey Inc., by contrast, maintains strong profit margins, though this is mainly a result of its size.

FAQs.question: What is the recruiting process for your employees? What kind of training are employees required to undertake?
FAQs.answer: Designing online survey tools often requires excruciatingly long hours. A skilled and flexible workforce will work efficiently for extended periods of time, covering many areas of operations from undertaking interviews to collating results.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations? Have you invested in the latest security systems for clients' data?
FAQs.answer: Consumers will not use an online survey software if they do not trust that their information and finances will be secure.

FAQs.question: How do you develop technology and systems that improve your internal capacities? How much of your revenue goes toward investing in new technology?
FAQs.answer: Online survey software companies must quickly adopt new survey or programming techniques to provide clients with what they are searching for.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue comes from corporate demand? How do you attract corporate business?
FAQs.answer: A drop in corporate profit leads to a decrease in market research and online survey spending, negatively affecting industry revenue. As corporate profit increases, businesses allocate more money to marketing and research budgets.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends in line with the percentage of services conducted online? Have you adapted your products to become more mobile-friendly?
FAQs.answer: Households are expected to spend more time online, often visiting websites that leverage online survey technology in order to offer consumer goods and financial services.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of trends in consumer disposable income? How do you attract business?
FAQs.answer: As consumer disposable income levels increase, the number of purchases they make will also rise. This would stimulate businesses to further their use of online survey software in order to provide more accurate knowledge of consumer preferences.
